meanings.definition: A decorative border or band in architecture or art.
meanings.sent1: The frises on the walls added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted intricate frises along the ceiling of the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the frises were a secret pathway for tiny fairies.
meanings.sent4: The frises on the building seemed to dance in the sunlight, bringing it to life.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the beautiful frises that adorned the ancient temple.

meanings.definition: A type of frozen dessert made from fruit juice or puree.
meanings.sent1: After dinner, we enjoyed a refreshing frises made with fresh strawberries.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream shop offered a variety of frises flavors to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they licked their frises, trying to catch the melting drips.
meanings.sent4: The frises tasted like a burst of summer in every spoonful.
meanings.sent5: The frises melted on my tongue, leaving a sweet and fruity sensation.

meanings.definition: A type of decorative molding or trim used in interior design.
meanings.sent1: The intricate frises along the walls added a touch of sophistication to the room.
meanings.sent2: The frises on the ceiling created a sense of height and grandeur in the hall.
meanings.sent3: The frises were so shiny that they reflected the light like tiny mirrors.
meanings.sent4: The frises seemed to frame the room, drawing attention to its beauty.
meanings.sent5: I ran my fingers along the frises, feeling the smoothness of the intricate designs.
